comment.author: 76204898@N00
comment._content: L.A. Times archive search (no direct link): ADELE" IS A FINE PARADOX. Enjoyable Play With a Poor Setting; Jules Epailly Eighth Wonder of the World; Pretty Carolyn Thompson Is Another Hit. Los Angeles Times (1886-1922) - Los Angeles, Calif. Author:HENRY CHRISTEEN WARNACK Date:Feb 17, 1914 --- The London premiere didn't turn out so well, apparently... New York Times archive: RESENT INVASION OF AMERICAN PLAYS; London Gallery Gods Boo "Adele" Apparently for No Other Reason. Special Correspondence of THE NEW YORK TIMES. June 14, 1914, Sunday Section: Cable Dispatches FOREIGN NEWS SPORTS WANT ADVERTISEMENTS, Page C4, 3418 words LONDON, June 3. -- When, the other evening, the final curtain fell after the London premiere of "Adele," the booing that came from the packed gallery seemed less an expression of critical displeasure than an outburst of accumulated resentment at the seizure and occupation of the theatres here by the plays, players and producers from New York.

comment.author: 76204898@N00
comment._content: Dated "12/27/[19]13" upside down at the bottom:

comment.author: 21686909@N07
comment._content: I have to say I never heard of her, but the photo is terrific.

comment.author: 22776410@N00
comment._content: Women look beautuful in dress like this. Who is she?

comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: "It was in the London production of 'Adele,' by the bye, that Carolyn Thomson, leading woman in 'Little Simplicity,' made her first hit. she is not an English girl, however, but a native of Minneapolis, where her appearance at high-school festivities revealed her talents. The war put an end to the 'Adele' engagement, practically her first, and on her return to this country she was at once snapped up for 'The Star Gazer.' Her last appearance previous to 'Simplicity' was as Ottilie with the Western company playing 'Maytime.'" --Matthew White Jr., "Theatre," Munsey's Magazine 66(1919): 165.

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: LOC -- your title misspells the name "Thomson."

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content:
"Carolyn Thomson was a soloist with the Minneapolis Symphony Orchestra when the great operatic soprano, Mme. Nellie Melba heard her sing and urged her to continue her career. Her first starring role was in the operetta, Adele, in London."
-----University of Maine Studies.

comment.author: 35234565@N04
comment._content: Thanks Wystan for pointing out the misspelling of the name.  We'll make the correction to the title next time we update the record.
